meanings.sent1: She managed to surmount the steep hill with determination.
meanings.sent2: The team worked together to surmount the challenges they faced.
meanings.sent3: Despite his fear of heights, he decided to surmount the tall ladder for fun.
meanings.sent4: Her positive attitude helped her surmount the obstacles like a skilled climber.
meanings.sent5: With unwavering courage, he surmounted every hurdle in his path.

meanings.definition: To be on top of or above
meanings.sent1: The flag proudly surmounted the highest peak of the mountain.
meanings.sent2: The castle's tower surmounts the rest of the structure.
meanings.sent3: The cherry on top perfectly surmounted the delicious cake.
meanings.sent4: The eagle gracefully surmounted the treetops as it soared.
meanings.sent5: The bright star seemed to surmount all others in the night sky.

meanings.sent1: Her determination allowed her to surmount all her competitors in the race.
meanings.sent2: The champion boxer always finds a way to surmount his opponents.
meanings.sent3: The clever fox managed to surmount the tricky maze with ease.
meanings.sent4: The hero's bravery helped him surmount the evil forces threatening the kingdom.
meanings.sent5: With sheer willpower, he surmounted every challenge that came his way.
